attributes.action: Allow college students to also have alternatives to exams
attributes.additional_details: Making us go into our college during a national lockdown and expecting us to be able to complete an exam to the best of our ability is unfair and a lot of other students I have spoken to feel the same. It is unfair  being in a lockdown and being told ‘do not go out’ yet then being told to sit in a classroom with many other students from many other areas everyone feels uneasy. The Summer exams should also have alternatives in place such as doing it from home to allow us a sense of security.
attributes.background: Allow college students to have alternatives put in place, making us go into college during a lockdown and expecting us to complete an exam is unfair, shown in A-level years. For example giving predicated results for our anatomy exam, and allow us to sit our cache exam from home with cameras on.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the impact of Covid-19 on your education, but it's not clear if you are talking about further or higher education.

Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.
                
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Cancel Vocational Exams NOW: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565615
